turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Am I right, did Sam sell you on the idea right up front, of whacking Suzie? That's murder, Kelly.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Police -- God -- get a life.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Get off my property.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not on your property!

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Is that Sam Lombardo?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hi, Mon.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Sam!  Hi!

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Which one of your "bodyguards" is that?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Whichever one I want.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Okay, what's the matter?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You notice my new jumper?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: My friends buy me clothes, so I don't look like trash.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I would hardly say you look like trash.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No thanks to you.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Kelly.  What is it?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I miss Dad.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Jesus.  Well, I do too, sometimes...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No you don't.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: He didn't have to kill himself, Kelly. He could have gone out and gotten a job. Christ, he could've found another rich woman... He never had a problem tucking my friends when we were married.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I was raped.  By Sam Lombardo.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: He... Sam Lombardo?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yes.  God, Mom...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You didn't have to fly back -- from -- wherever, for me...

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I'm here to congratulate my friends and their children.  I'm leaving again tonight.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Don't bother.  I'm taking a trip.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Where, the mall?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: A friend of mine bought a boat.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Okay, try me on Sunday.  I'm going out to the Everglades on Saturday.  You guys can wash the mud off.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Deal.  You know, I just looked out front.  My ride wasn't there.  You suppose you could give me one?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Don't forget the car wash.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I won't.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Look, he forgot.  I knew it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No I didn't.  Check out the Jeep.  It's nice and dirty for you.  But you might want to wait a minute. The Mercedes is leaving.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Where's the hose?  We can set up.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: In back of the garage.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So, where you off to now?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Aren't  you forgetting something?  Your coupon.  We gotta have it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jeez, that thing... Can't you...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Rules are rules, Mr. Lombardo.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: All right.  I'll have to look for it.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Mr. Lombardo.  We're running kind of late.  How about if Nicole goes on to the Mansons?  You could give me a ride when you find the ticket.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Kelly...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Drop dead... You know where my mom is trying to get the money to pay you off? She's trying to break my trust.  How do you like that?  I can't touch it until she's dead and she won't give me a dime and now she's trying to break it to pay you...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Look, Kelly... I'm sorry... I know what you've been through... I should've seen something like this coning.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jesus Christ, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: So you got my mom's money.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: About six and a half million dollars.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: God, you scared the shit out of me.  You must be crazy coming here.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Of course I'm crazy.  Ask my mom.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: From now on, if we're seen together, it's got to be accidental.  I thought that was understood...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hey, come on... We've got to have at least one victory party.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The only way we're gonna blow this now, is if we do it ourselves...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Do it to ourselves?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We have to stick with the plan.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Stick?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Kelly.  Is Suzie there?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Shit.  I was afraid of that.  She left this garbled message on my machine.  Can you calm her down?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Why can't you come...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No!  Christ.  Listen, Kelly, I'm counting on you.  You calm her down. I mean do whatever you have to, whatever it takes...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You know what it takes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Then do it.  I need you on this Kelly. Do it tonight.  We'll figure something out... Okay?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Okay.  I want you to hear this too. We've got to be cool.  All of us. People think I'm rich, for Christ's sake.   I'm doing what rich guys do.  I'm spending my money.  It's more suspicious if I sit around doing nothing.  Now don't let this cop fuck with your minds.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm sorry, Kelly.  I'm sorry it had to happen like this.  She was losing it...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: There was no way.  That cop would've gotten her to tell him... everything. She was weak and dumb...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: God, I've been calling you.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm really serious.  That cop, he keeps watching me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Duquette.  Forget him...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I can't help it.  He gives me the creeps... I mean why was Suzie so scared of him?  She's not that way.  I think he did something...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah, he got her busted for possession...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I don't know... I think it was something else... Suzie says the bust was bullshit...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And you believe her?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I don't know.  I want to see you...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Kelly... Relax.  Take one of your mom's valium or something.  In another week you get on the plane.  It's over.  We're rich.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: But what if they find out... God, they'd put you in the gas chamber...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So if they're tapping your phone, we're dead.  Stay in the guest house.  Skip the graduation parties.  You'll never see Duquette.  Okay?  I love you.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Okay.  I love you too.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: That never seemed to worry you at the Glades.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's not your line.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Say you love me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I love you.  Now give me the line.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No little girl can ever make me come.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm running away.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You think that's wise?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Um-huh.  And guess what else?  I have toys.

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: But check this...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Ken.  I'm in some trouble.  I need an attorney and you're the only one I know. So I figured I'd start here.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Good thinking.

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: You can tie whoever did it to Sandra Van Ryan...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: Lady has some deep pockets.  That's all I'm saying.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know how deep her pockets are, Ken.  I thought I might be able to save my fucking house with an equity loan. Guess who's on the board of directors at the bank?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Can't you take that stupid thing off?

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: Not in here.  Chiropractor comes in here for lunch sometimes.

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: You're not in bad shape, really.  I know you think you are, but you're not.  Let me tell you why.  Sandra Van Ryan.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: For you to be getting this kind of heat, for what they have on you... It doesn't add up.  Sandra Van Ryan's got 'em running scared.  And I'll tell you something else, you rush, you get careless.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Nellie Gail Ranch...

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: Sound nice?  It's a fucking drug rehab farm.  It's where Kelly Van Ryan went when her morn fished her out of the swamp.  Meanwhile, you get educator of the year I mean there's no way they can put this thing in front of a jury.  Shit, they haven't even taken your statement yet.  Reason?  They're still shoveling dirt and my guess is, they're coming up empty.  Now tell me I'm right.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There's nothing for them to get.

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: Good.  So what we're going to do is march right to Hunter's doorstep.  We're going to insist they take a statement. We're going to tell them to charge your ass or get off your back.  They're walking a fine line here. Defamation of character, malicious prosecution...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I just want my life back...

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: Fair enough.  Let's go make a statement.

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: Come on, let loose!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I was just thinking about where I'm gonna stay.  I lost the house.  It's like waking up from a goddamn nightmare.

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: You'll get over it. We've got a knockdown, airtight, motherfucker of a lawsuit against Sandra Van Ryan.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Just like that?

turns.speaker: KEN
turns.text: Just like that?  These people ruined your life, bro.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're saying that Kelly was raped by Sam Lombardo.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Detective Duquette, Ms. Van Ryan.  Let me in.  Now.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Where she lives.  In the guest house. Now will you tell me what this is about?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm placing your daughter under arrest.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: You can't...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Suzie Toller is dead.  You don't want Kelly to be next, then take my advice. Stay out of my way.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Meet my partner, Gloria Perez.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I did.  At Blue Balls.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: It's Celine.  He's okay.  He had a pretty good line on what cheap fucks people are.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So Suzie, you called us, remember?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Will they?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It doesn't look like it.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Then he'll be back at Blue Balls?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You ought to watch it with that shit, Suzie.  You get busted again, you go back in a two-tine loser.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You got something against cigarettes?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, they're bad for your health.  I'm tryin' to look out for you...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: That's cop bullshit.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well, you're half right.  Best thing you could do for yourself right now would be to talk to me.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Every triangle I've ever seen never lasts.  Somebody's got to go.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Is this supposed to mean something to me?  What triangle?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You, Kelly, Sam.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I don't have to listen to this.  And you can't shove me around.  I have friends now...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Is that what you think?  You have friends?  Is that what they told you?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I don't mean who you're thinking.  I have other friends...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Suzie, Suzie... This is me, Ray, you're talking to.  We both know you don't have shit, never have had shit, never will have shit...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Get away from me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't you see what this means?  You really think Sam and Kelly are gonna give you a third of the money?  You, the pill-head with the rap sheet?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Davy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's right.  That was his name.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You... I should've killed you myself. should never have left it up to him...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Shoulda, coulda, woulda...  Get him in the water.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sam, for godsake.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Hey, Ray.  Guess whose name is on the numbered bank account besides yours and Sam's?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Why don't you tell us one more time, how Kelly came to be with you, alone in your house.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Story's the same, Detective...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I had to go look for this coupon.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The one you bought at school.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Like I said, I hadn't really expected to use it.  Anyway, I'm going through a drawer.  I hear a car.  I look out the window.  I see Nicole driving away.  I leave my room, and there's Kelly.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: In cutoffs, a wet T-shirt.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: And she wanted to talk.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: But you can't tell us what she wanted to talk about.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I could, but it's confidential.  Look, the point is, we didn't talk.  I told her this was not an appropriate time or place.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: And she began to cry.  And you put an arm around her.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes.  Mainly to turn her toward the door.  I told her we would talk on Monday, in the office.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: But she ran away.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: But you do admit to touching her, to putting your arm around her.  Isn't that against the rules?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It is and I don't.  Ordinarily...  But, I mean... there's this kid standing in front of you crying...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: With a thirty-five inch bustline in a wet T-shirt with no bra...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Fuck you.  This is bullshit.  I'm outta here.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sit down, Lombardo.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah, well, you fixed that.  What the hell happened, anyway?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The bitch shot me, is what happened.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey, what did you want me to do, die?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, shit, you're the cop, they don't teach you to disarm people, shoot them in the leg or something?  You weren't supposed to kill her for Christ's sake.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Did you become squeamish about these things before or after you bludgeoned little Suzie Toller to death with a wine bottle?  Jesus, man. It couldn't have worked out better. They're convinced Kelly whacked Suzie. I can't talk 'em out of it.  We should be celebrating.  This thing worked out just like you said, only better.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Kelly was supposed to be framed, not killed.  What I'm telling you is, I don't like surprises.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You mean this thing?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes, we call it a winch.  And these are shrouds, and these are stays.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I thought this was supposed to be a vacation.  Why didn't you buy a nice big power boat?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Come on, man.  I'll make a sailor out of you yet.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, or get me drowned.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jesus, man... You okay?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That how you planned it?  You take cut Suzie, get me to hang it on Kelly, then dump me in the ocean...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Come off it, man... It was an accident.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: How much is about six and a half million divided by three?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jesus.  Two million one hundred thirty-three thousand three hundred thirty-three and change.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Sam...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Put Kelly on too.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: But I..

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Shut up.  Don't fall apart.  The only people who can blow this is us. Remember?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Good.  Just keep telling yourselves that, the only people who can fuck this up is us.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I was worried about you, Suzie.  I decided we should all get together, one more time, before we split up.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Are you mad at me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, no.  Look, I probably should have told you a little more, about the part I intended to play.  We'll go through it all again tonight.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That was about as grim as it gets.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: The guy was history when he killed Kelly.  You knew that.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: But then you knew what he was like all along... Maybe his killing Kelly was a thing you had counted on...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: But then it is better this way, don't you think?  No loose ends.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That was the same thing Ray said.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Fuck the winch.  I wanna drive.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Seems to like some of the same places you do.  Funny you never met.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah, real funny.  You're wrong about this, I could get busted on the spot.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Trust me, the guy's dirty.  He'll like it.  Especially the part about offing me.  Now get out of here.  Go make yourself a new friend.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I've seen you out there in your old air boat, thinking about what might have been, old man Van Ryan hadn't fucked you out of it.  What if I told you I had a way we could get a big piece of it back?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Well, I'd need the famous Lombardo charm, not that you'd have to do anything you haven't done already.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Walter.  He's been aimin' that Brownie through knotholes for years.  I saw these, I knew he'd finally struck gold.  I can't decide which came out better, that little straw Kelly's got up her nose, or that vibrator you've got up her ass.  What do you think, Mr. Lombardo?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I think there's some things you do, you don't want to see yourself doing them.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: What?  You're going to drive off without even saying hi?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hi, Sandy.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Why don't you come in, have a drink?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Can't.  Got a passenger.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I can't, Sandy.  I've got to run.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I'll bet.  Look, Sam.  Why don't you come by this weekend.  We'll take the boat out...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sorry, Sandy.  I've got plans.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: What?  Running over alligators with that silly swamp jalopy when you could be sailing a real boat...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Swamp's where it's at, Sandy.  Gives you a look into the muck we all crawled out of.  You ought to try it some time.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sandy... What's up?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Listen, Kelly skipped school.  Have you talked to her?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Shit. Here we go again.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Didn't you see her this morning?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: To tell you the truth, I haven't seen her since Friday.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Look.  I know you're seeing Barbara Baxter.  So what?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So maybe I'm a one-woman man.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Grab a clue, Sam.  You're a hired hand around here.  Enjoy it while it lasts.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Goodbye, Sandra.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: J. S. Bach.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Jim West.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Artemus Gordon.  Bach, he's the composer.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't mind him, but who the hell are you... my valet or something?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Valet?  You jest of course.  I am a U.S. Marshal.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Funny.  So am I.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Congratulations.  Unfortunately, my train is about to leave, and I really must insist you disembark.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Your train?  Listen, friend, you're obviously lost.  ... I've got orders here to take possession of this train and to investigate a certain crime.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Interesting.  Mine say the same thing, and they don't mention you, not even as a valet, although we could talk...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Just another bureaucratic foul-up. You know how these pencil-pushers are.  So, why don't you just run on back and explain what happened?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Funny, I was just thinking you should do the same.  Since I am already in residence, and am obviously the man for the job, it's been grand making your acquaintance, sir.  And best of luck in all your future endeavors.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You're quite the wordsmith, fiddle boy.  But nobody smooth-talks his way into my assignment.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: If you're implying our little imbroglio has reached an impasse whose only resolution can be found in a more primitive fashion, then I for one am fully prepared to do so... al fresco.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: But don't pull that again.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Wouldn't dream of it.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Eight scientists.  Eight different fields of endeavor.  Hydraulics, optics, ballistics...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Put them all together and what do we have?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: A giant... hydraulically operated microscope... that explodes?  Or maybe just someone who hates scientists.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Then why kidnap them?  Why not just kill them?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: "Ay, there's the rub."  Take a look at this file on Professor Morton.  Quite a brilliant fellow... metallurgy.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Sorry.  Didn't mean that.  Just a little device of mine...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Now I know where I've heard of you.  You're the gadget guy.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: "Gadget guy?"  While I may not be in a league with these unfortunate geniuses, I am, sir, in my own humble way, a man of science.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Attractive buttons, yes?  But yank one off, toss it, and poof!  It emits a cloud of sleeping gas.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You need that real often?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Always hoping.  Or this...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No offense, but all I ever need...  Are these...  And this.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Good Lord, man.  The world is changing.  And mark me, it is always the criminal mind that is the first to exploit modern invention.  We, as defenders of the right, must keep pace!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: All right, if it'll make you happy, I'll try that.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Try what?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Your little jack-in-the-box gun. That might be useful.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Well... it's the only one I have. It's gotten me out of quite a few tight spots...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That should put us ahead of the criminals.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: I'll work on it.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Aha!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Aha?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Yes, aha.  A brass screw.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Is this leading somewhere?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Potentially.  This is the painstaking process of piecing together clues.  The cornerstone of the modern science of criminology.  Piece by piece we reconstruct the identity of the villain.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Starting with a screw?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Yes.  Starting with a screw.  Now, it's not fair of me to expect someone who's spent his life wrangling with Western desperadoes to fully appreciate what I'm doing here, but...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What about the explosive?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Limestone quarry?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Limestone quarry, Southern mansion. Easy to get them mixed up... I say we invite ourselves to the party.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Absolutely.  Have to look for clues... even if it means dancing with beautiful women.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Doyle, once around the park.  I need a moment to prepare.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Prepare what?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: My disguise.  And here...

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Come Llewellyn, don't tarry.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Call me that again, and you're going to find a boot where it doesn't belong.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Jim, people talk to foreigners, speak more openly, especially to those as famous as I, Chauncey McNeil Armstrong, English lyric poet.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That's a lot of butler.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Quite.  Come, let's mingle.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Do your own mingling.  I'm not hanging around with some dandy named Chauncey.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Doctor V. L. Pemberton.  I knew it.  He's a scientist all right. Inventor of the Pemberton Condensed Steam Engine.  I'm telling you, Artemus, Loveless is our man.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Whoa, Jim.  Maybe.  But we can't arrest this little pillar of society on maybe.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: All right.  How about this?  We put a watch on this Pemberton, somebody tries to grab him...

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Then we've got our proof. Excellent.  And where do we find this fortunate scientist?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: You know your Morse Code almost as well as I.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Almost?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Yes.  Now, observe....

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You feeling all right?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Come on, Jim.  I'm serious.  Dot...  Dash.  It'll be our secret means of communication should we ever need it.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Now, what was that?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You're either having a seizure or you just said "hello."

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Good, I wasn't sure you were up to it.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: What was all that back there?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: All what?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: All that jumping and kicking.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That?  Oh, it's a kind of Chinese fighting... I was sort of caught once with a lovely Chinese girl out in San Francisco.  Her big brothers were kind enough to teach it to me  I've got a book on it, if you're interested.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Garrison...?  Then the President was right.  Except it's not a foreign power, it's a bunch of die- hard Rebels trying to make the South rise again.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And if they've got Dr. Loveless building weapons like those flying bombs... they just might do it.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Could I just point out, this is a perfect example of the criminal mind exploiting modern invention.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm going to hit you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Never seen a gun fire so fast!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: It's a repeating steam cannon!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: At least I tried something.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Hey, I tried the board.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Damn it, this is ridiculous.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: At least the thing's not that fast. We just follow it.  Whenever it stops, we're there, waiting.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: That's right... That's good.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Jim, are you all right?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No, I'm not all right.  They got away.  And we can't even follow them.  They can get off the tracks anywhere they want.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Which is why we're heading to Houston, Texas.  Home of the Loveless Steam Engine Works.
